lines.text: Any last requests?
Yeah, how about the long version of 'Stairway to Heaven'?
I'm afraid zat is not where you are going.
[Roy Knable is about to be executed by the guillotine]
How come he dresses like a woman?
I do that sometimes.
Holy Shatner!
[as cartoon mice]
Boy, this is strange!
Strange? I'm an animated rodent wearing high-heel running shoes. The word "strange" is somehow lacking.
[as a cartoon mouse, Roy is trapped in a donut while Robocat is shooting at him]
My doctor was right. Doughnuts will be the death of me.
Wait a sec... you don't get it, do you? Without me, you don't get out of here.
Sorry, Spike, you're cancelled!
Dynamite. He's going to hit me with a train AND blow me up? ROY!
[Helen and Roy Knable get sucked out of the HVTV dish and land in their backyard - the Knables' neighbor's dog is in their yard]
Whoever left the gate open is grounded for a week.
[the dog runs toward the Knables and then get sucked into the HVTV dish]
Check that. Whoever left the gate open gets double their allowance.
[Roy and Helen Knable, as cartoon mice, push a hair dryer towards a water-filled tub to electrocute Robocat]

[to viewers]
Kids, don't try this at home.
Ew, you're the ugliest bitch in perdition - but you've given me a beautiful idea.

[to Roy]
Oh, you'll get us out? Your leadership skills couldn't get us out of a T-shirt!
Now, if you excuse me, I'm off to warmer megahertz. Gonna find a channel with sun, funny little drinks with those funny unbrellas, and maybe a dog track.

[Crowley checks to see if the wolves took off]
All clear.
[a wolf then jumps from the roop onto Crowley and a couple more stars biting him; Crowley yells and screams]

[Screaming]
I'm already dead! Save her!
[the inside of a prison is shown on an HVTV channel]
Coming this fall... Thirty-Something-To-Life.
All right. Now, I understand you're searching for your lovely wife Helen... who I truly believe you will find, because good always conquers over evil...

[together]
Not!
[Roy Knable is in a black-and-white detective movie]

[while Roy reads his card]
Roy Knable, private dick. Well, better than being a public dick.

And now the all-new mini-series about the French Revolution... Off With His Head, the story of the Marquis de Knable, an enemy of the people, who tries to escape the guillotine by wearing a disguise. It's an epic drama of love, danger, and cross-dressing.
[Hooded men are about to carry Roy Knable to the guillotine]
Hi, fellas, I loved you in Star Wars.
[Roy Knable was freed from the guillotine, and Crowley was (still) missing one of his arms and one of his legs]

[to Helen and Roy Knable]
We did it! We beat Spike! Oh, I would have given an arm and a leg to see this! In fact, I already did!
[Roy Knable is about to go back into HVTV to rescue Helen Knable]

[to Diane and Darryl Knable]
Now I want you both to stay inside. You just make sure those doughnuts are ready. I'm going to be very hungry when I get back.
[Darryl Knable transmits his voice through the HVTV dish to the set of Off With His Head]
Dad, can you hear me?
Darryl? My God!
God?
Yes! It's... God!
[Roy Knable and Spike are about to have a showdown]
Make your move, tinhorn.
[They stare at each other for quite a few seconds]

[still tied to a wagon on railroad tracks and to be hit by a train eventually]
Today, Roy!
[Roy Knable arrives inside a castle]
My, my. Now you'll never get back to Kansas.
[Roy looks behind him and sees that his remote is shattered into pieces]

[raising his sword]
En garde.
[Roy gets a wooden stick]
Oh, no sword. Have to talk to that prop man.
[breaks the stick]
Right about now, your wife is probably catching that train... right between the eyes. And you let it happen.

[hurling one of Roy's swords towards the HVTV dish]
Here it comes, Dad!
[the sword gets sucked in the dish]
I've taken loads of souls... and none more pathetic than yours, Roy. Say good night, Gracie.

[catching his sword tossed by Darryl]
Not yet.
[he starts dueling with Spike]
You see, I was captain of my junior college fencing team. All right. Co-captain.
[Helen Knable and Roy Knable, who in turn is holding a remote, are about to get hit by a train]
Roy, what do you do when you want the TV to go away? You turn it...

[together]
Off!
[Spike is on a chandelier]
Oh, incidentally, Spike, nice of you to drop in. Ha ha ha ha... Ah... that's funny.
[He hacks, with his axe, the rope that holds up the chandelier, and Spike falls]
I get his parking space.
/ HVTV Fall Lineup / Beverly Hills 90666 / I Love Lucifer / The Golden Ghouls / Murder She Likes / Facts Of Life Support / Fresh Prince Of Darkness / Unmarried With Children / David Dukes Of Hazard
Mon cherie, you inflame me.

[in a woman's voice]
I never kiss on the first date.
Eh?
Naughty boy.
[hits the solder in the chest]
This has been a kick fellas, but we gotta go.
No, No! Come back here, sweetheart.

[Woman's voice]
Hey you keep your hands off her!

[Noticing Roy's fake wig]
You hair is so beautiful. May I have a lock of it?

[Solder pulls wig off Roy; Roy gasps]
Why don't you keep the whole thing?

[to Pierce]
Trust me, Babe, you walked into the right place. Very cushy down here. I mean, you can cool your heels in here for the rest of eternity *if* you kiss the right ass. And let me tell ya', these lips ain't calloused for nothing.
[Roy Knable, played by John Ritter, arrives on the set of Three's Company. The theme from Three's Company is being played, and Janet and Crissy open the door and enter the set]

[together]
Where have you been?

[looking towards the camera]
Aaaaaahhhh!
[as cartoon mice, Helen threatens to leave Roy]
Where are you going to go, your cartoon mother's house?

[on the set of HV One (News)]
This just in... Helen Knable has been kidnapped and taken to Channel 1. We take you there live.

[tied to a wagon on railroad tracks]
Roy, I don't know where you are, but get your butt back here!
Unfortunately, her gutless failure of a husband won't lift a finger to save her. Isn't that right, Roy?
No.
Nice disguise. Interesting concept. Diagonal boobs. Could you fix that thing?
You sadistic bastard!
Runs in the family! My father was an oil company president.
[Helen and Roy Knable are sucked into the HVTV dish]
Fasten your seat belts, folks. It's going to be a bumpy ride! Ha, ha, ha, ha!
Do you know the rules of our game?

[not sure where she is]
What game?
Screw up in here, and you're dead meat... dead meat.
[in a wrestling ring]
In this corner, Roy "The Couch Potato" Knable and his wife Helen The Heroin!
O.K. everything goes - maim, murder each other, I don't care, but keep it clean. Okay, go to your corners, and when the bell rings, kill or be killed.
[Darryl Knable's cap and BMX bike get sucked into the HVTV dish]
What are you doing?
Did you see that? That dish, it ate my BMX.
Is this some sort of male puberty thing?
Let me get this straight. We've been sucked into some kind of TV world?
Are you saying that that salesman was...
Mr. Spike - Mephistopheles of the cathode ray, big brother to the ungrateful dead.

[to Roy]
You wanted to live in a TV fantasy? Well, you got your wish.
[a HVTV commercial promoting "The Silencer of the Lambs"; A family's children is singing "Row, Row, Row Your Boat too loudly in the car and is bothering the parents]

[furious]
Oh! These kids are driving me crazy!
I wish there was some way to shut them up!
For those long, tedious car trips, you need...
[loud clang noise; The kids now have masks and straitjackets on]
The Silencer of the Lambs. Driving will never be the same. "The Silencer of the Lambs".
[loud clang noise; The dog has a mask on as well]
Silencer of the Pets sold separately.
[Helen and Roy Knable, are cornered by one of the wolves]
Jump.
Jump?
Wherever it leads can't be any worse than this! Go!

[Helen jumps into that conduit. Roy tries to jump there as well, but he doesn't fit through that hole. He makes that hole bigger, and wolves approach him. Roy finally falls through that conduit before the wolves could get him]

[falling]
Yeow!
[Roy lands in a cartoon, as a cartoon mouse]
Umph!

[also as a cartoon mouse]
Couldn't be any worse, huh, Roy?
Helen? Oh, my god!
[he looks at and holds up his tail]
We're cartoons.
How can you even think of eating doughnuts at a time like this?
What should I do, look for some oat bran? I'm starved.
[Roy and Helen Knable are cartoon mice]
For a mouse, you, um, look pretty sexy.
Too bad you didn't like the way I looked when I was human.
I always did.
News to me.
How did James Dean really die? Find out tonight on Autopsies Of The Rich And Famous.
Welcome to Northern Overexposure, the story of a young doctor from New York who comes to Alaska, complains about everything, and freezes to death.
[in a cartoon]

[to Helen Knable]
At least we're safe here. No one ever dies in cartoons, right?
[Robocat covers up a conduit with a metal plate]
This is one clever pussy.
[Roy Knable, as a cartoon mouse, has an idea of handling Robocat]
This will put a permanent crease in his shorts.
[the doorbell chimes]
Identify yourself.
Catnip-gram.
[Roy Knable, as a cartoon mouse, is about to leave the cartoon through a conduit]

[to viewers]
Deeb-a-deeb-a-deeb - that's all folks.
It's My Three Sons Of Bitches.
[on the set of Duane's Underworld, a segment of Saturday Nite Dead]
All right. Welcome to Duane's Underworld, O Father of Lies. I'm your excrement host Duane, and with me as always is my only slightly decaying co-host Garf.

[lifting up his right armpit]
Wifto!
[Duane and Garf look at Helen Knable in a Devil Dolls magazine]
She's a vixen, Mr. K.
Beezle-babe! Tent pole!
You creeps!
Uh-oh. Extreme close-up on Mr. Knable.

[together]
Oh!
[Roy Knable escapes from the set of Duane's Underworld]
Bogus.
Cool down. Shake it out. O.K., now vomit.
[a boy finishes a can of Yogi Beer and then burps loudly]

[to his mother]
Give me another one, babe.
That's my boy.

[to Darryl]
You're pizza topping!
Wait. Mom and Dad are here.
They're home?
Well, not exactly.
[he points to the TV set]
Look.
[Roy Knable is on TV as a detective]
Where's my husband?
What are you worried about him for? I ditched my wife five channels ago. She happened to meet the business end of a fifty-ton reptile. And I can tell you, I don't exactly miss dried meat loaf.
[Murray Seidenbaum gets shot. Roy Knable approaches him]

[to Roy, just before dying]
All I wanted was to be the big shot for once. Take my remote.
The next item we have for you on the Home Shoplifting Channel...
Stay tuned for the final chapter of Off With His Head, when the Marquis de Knable finally loses his.
[two French revolutionary soldiers approach Helen and Roy Knable]
You are both under arrest!
For what?
For being too beautiful and without proper escort.
[Spike arrives on the set of Off With His Head and notices that Crowley was missing one of his arms and one of his legs]
Crowley. Quite a radical weight-loss plan you've been on.
[Roy Knable arrives at Channel 1. As he approaches Helen Knable to save her, Spike steps in the way]

[to Roy]
Back to play the hero, huh?
[At Knable Fencing Academy, Roy Knable and one of his students practice fencing with each other]
Who on earth taught you that?
Uh, I saw it on TV somewhere. Some old movie.
Take my advice, kiddo. Don't watch too much TV. It can get you into trouble.

[before a wrestling match gets started]
No holds barred. No transfusions allowed.
I've lost the feeling in my arm.
All of a sudden, I can't see anything.
[they collapse]
00... Different Strokes.
...And, of course, win or lose, every contestant takes home a set of the Encyclopedia Satanica.
I would have given you chocolates.

[reading the death sentence]
By order of the court...
Looks like Spike's gonna make his quota after all. I'm sorry, Mrs. Knable.
...I deliver the soul of the Marquis de Knable to it's RIGHTFUL OWNER!
Finally, he's mine!
Set phasers to... Torture!
